node.text: Grimoires are no ordinary relics. I wonder, what do you know of the Ancient Civilization, the Qaesthari?

option.optiontext: Gabrius spoke of them some; a society of powerful magic wielders?

node.text: Indeed, the Qaeshtari quite literally lived and breathed magic. They practiced a ritual that would transform their very bodies, to become ''ascended'' - they became closesly linked with magic, body and soul.

Thus to become a fully fledged member of the Qaeshtari society, one would have had to endure this transformation. The non-ascended became a lower caste. And for all ascended, it became an important tradition to craft their personal 'Grimoire'.

option.optiontext: But what was the Grimoire?
What of this Black Grimoire, how could Gabrius create such a thing?

node.text: It was no mere spellbook, though it may have once started out as such. But it came to be an embodiment of magic. It was a personal statement of its creator, capable of altering the world in fundamental ways.

For instance, a Grimoire I uncovered was capable of perfectly concealing its owner from those they did not wish to be found by. I can only imagine who its writer must have been, someone who valued their privacy a great deal. And it offered me sanctuary, once I became hunted by Gaberion.

option.optiontext: But its power was broken by another Grimoire - the one I acquired, of Truesight.
What of this Black Grimoire, how could Gabrius create such a thing?

node.text: Indeed... some Grimoires always were inherently more powerful than others. Some were considered highly dangerous and were prohibited.

option.optiontext: What of this Black Grimoire, how could Gabrius create such a thing?

node.text: We were younger then, talented and ambitious... scarred, also, by the Sorcerer's Uprising we'd experienced back in Vhosphoran Kingdom. We hungered to replace the losses of the war with wonders of magic.

And what better way to do so than to grasp for powers only the Ancient Qaeshtari ever wielded? Could you imagine, a Grimoire that could birth life, create lush paradise where before there was nothing but desert? Ah, it was naive of course.

But we were driven, and we scoured through numerous ruins in search of their secrets. In the end we learned so much, came so close, so many times... Only to discover that the man we considered our leader had warped our life's work to his own twisted purposes all along.
